==Events==
*[[1533]] &ndash; [[Conquistador]]s from Spain under the leadership of [[Francisco Pizarro]] arrive in [[Cajamarca]], [[Inca Empire]].
*[[1770]] &ndash; [[James Bruce]] discovers what he believes to be the source of the [[Nile]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[President of the United States|President]] [[Abraham Lincoln]] approves General [[Ambrose Burnside]]'s plan to capture the [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] capital at [[Richmond, Virginia]], leading to the [[Battle of Fredericksburg]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; Pioneering female journalist [[Nellie Bly]] (aka Elizabeth Cochrane) begins a successful attempt to travel around the world in less than 80 days. She completes the trip in seventy-two days.
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Aviator]] [[Eugene Burton Ely]] performs the first [[takeoff|take off]] from a ship in [[Hampton Roads]], [[Virginia]]. He took off from a makeshift deck on the [[USS Birmingham (CL-2)|USS ''Birmingham'']] in a [[Curtiss Model D|Curtiss pusher]].
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Battle of the Somme]] ends.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Czechoslovakia]] becomes a republic.
*[[1921]] &ndash; Foundation of the [[Communist Party of Spain]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; The [[British Broadcasting Company|BBC]] begins radio service in the United Kingdom.
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: In England, [[Coventry Blitz|Coventry is heavily bombed]] by German [[Luftwaffe]] bombers. [[Coventry Cathedral]] is almost completely destroyed.
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: The [[aircraft carrier]] {{HMS|Ark Royal|91|6}} sinks due to torpedo damage from the {{GS|U-81|1941|6}} sustained on November 13.
*  1941   &ndash; World War II: In [[Slonim]], German forces engaged in [[Operation Barbarossa]] murder 9,000 Jews in a single day.
*[[1952]] &ndash; The first regular [[UK Singles Chart]] published by the [[NME|New Musical Express]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[Apalachin Meeting]] outside [[Binghamton, New York]] is raided by law enforcement, and many high level Mafia figures are arrested.
*[[1965]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: The [[Battle of Ia Drang]] begins &ndash; the first major engagement between regular American and [[North Vietnam]]ese forces.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Congress of Colombia]], in commemoration of the 150 years of the death of [[Policarpa Salavarrieta]], declares this day as "Day of the Colombian Woman".
*  1967   &ndash; American physicist [[Theodore Maiman]] is given a patent for his [[ruby laser]] systems, the world's first laser.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Apollo program]]: [[NASA]] launches ''[[Apollo 12]]'', the second [[Space exploration|crewed mission]] to the surface of the [[Moon]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Soviet Union]] enters [[International Civil Aviation Organization|ICAO]], making Russian the fourth official language of organization.
*  1970   &ndash; [[Southern Airways Flight 932]] crashes in the mountains near [[Huntington, West Virginia]], killing 75, including members of the [[Marshall University]] [[American football|football]] team.
*[[1971]] &ndash; Enthronment of [[Pope Shenouda III of Alexandria|Pope Shenouda III]] as [[Pope of the Coptic Orthodox Church of Alexandria|Pope of Alexandria]].
*  1971   &ndash; ''[[Mariner 9]]'' enters orbit around [[Mars]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; In the United Kingdom, [[Anne, Princess Royal|Princess Anne]] marries [[Captain (British Army and Royal Marines)|Captain]] [[Mark Phillips]], in [[Westminster Abbey]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; Spain abandons [[Western Sahara]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; [[Iran hostage crisis]]: US President [[Jimmy Carter]] issues [[Executive order]] 12170, freezing all Iranian assets in the United States in response to the [[Iran hostage crisis|hostage crisis]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Lech Wałęsa]], the leader of [[Poland]]'s outlawed [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]] movement, is released after eleven months of [[internment]] near the Soviet border.
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[Zamboanga City]] mayor [[Cesar Climaco]], a prominent critic of the government of Philippine President [[Ferdinand Marcos]], is assassinated in his home city.
*[[1990]] &ndash; After [[German reunification]], the [[Germany|Federal Republic of Germany]] and [[Poland]] sign a treaty confirming the [[Oder–Neisse line]] as the border between Germany and Poland.
*[[1991]] &ndash; American and British authorities announce indictments against two Libyan [[Intelligence assessment|intelligence]] officials in connection with the downing of the [[Pan Am Flight 103]].
*  1991   &ndash; Cambodian Prince [[Norodom Sihanouk]] returns to [[Phnom Penh]] after thirteen years of [[exile]].
*  1991   &ndash; In [[Royal Oak, Michigan]], a [[Termination of employment|fired]] [[United States Postal Service]] employee goes on a [[going postal|shooting rampage]], killing four and wounding five before committing suicide.
*[[1995]] &ndash; A budget standoff between [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrats]] and [[Republican Party (United States)|Republicans]] in the [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] forces the [[Federal government of the United States|federal government]] to [[United States federal government shutdown of 1995 and 1996|temporarily close]] national parks and museums and to run most government offices with skeleton staffs.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[War in Afghanistan (2001–present)|War in Afghanistan]]: Afghan [[Northern Alliance]] fighters take over the capital [[Kabul]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; Astronomers [[Michael E. Brown]], [[Chad Trujillo]], and [[David L. Rabinowitz]] discover [[90377 Sedna]], a [[Trans-Neptunian object]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[2008 G-20 Washington summit|first G-20 economic summit]] opens in Washington, D.C.
*[[2010]] &ndash; Germany's [[Sebastian Vettel]] of [[Red Bull Racing]] wins [[Formula One]]'s Drivers Championship to become the sport's youngest champion.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Israel]] launches a [[Operation Pillar of Defense|major military operation]] in the [[Gaza Strip]], as hostilities with [[Hamas]] escalate.
